Is there way to delete the last character from buffer?
```buffer = IOBuffer()
print(buffer, "some")
pop!(buffer)
deleteat!(buffer, 4)```
does not work

text:
No, I don't think so. You can do this:
```buffer = IOBuffer()
truncate(buffer, position(buffer) - 1)```
this will remove one byte, but not one character if you have multi-byte characters

text:
it doesn't make sense to do index pop/insert on a "buffer". It is not an array unless you read it into an array first.

truncate or just read (3 `Char`) out are both good alternative:
```julia> a = read(buffer, 3)
3-element Array{UInt8,1}:
 0x73
 0x6f
 0x6d

julia> String(a)
"som"```
